We both like stupid movies a lot, ie-Napoleon Dynamite, Naked Gun, etc. but this was just too much.  Scaring off attacking lobsters with melted butter is where I draw the line from stupid-funny to just plain stupid.  Definately not one of Cosby's better moments.  Definately rent before you buy!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Whenever Bill Cosby has something to say, I'm all ears.  When he talked about how bad pound cakes are, I followed his every word.  And when he asked people to not watch "Leonard Part 6", a film that he produced and starred in, I would most humbly respect his request.  WOULD, as I emphasize, but I have obligations.  It's so hard to pinpoint what aspect of this film is he most embarrassed about: was it the lack of actual spy content to parody, the random jokes, the ballerina scene, the whole art direction which looks more tackier than "The Wiz", or just all of the above?  Needless to say, he has the right to be embarrassed.  It was one of the most critically panned movies of the '80s and even got plenty of Razzies as a result.  But personally, I would be glad to 'quelish' a movie like "Soul Plane" over this so-called parody movie, because while this is beyond saving, at least it kept itself clean.For being a way lesser movie than "Ghost Dad", I must say Cosby acted better in this movie.  Partly because he's subdued with his character, having none of his usual emphasized audaciousness that became a parody for years to come.  He played a former spy named Leonard who's been forcefully recruited by his secret organization to take down an evil Diana Ross (look-alike) from using small animals to slaughter mankind.  It is rather amusing that the good guys were being killed by the like frogs and trouts...that sounds like a Weird Al song, doesn't it?  But the amusement lasted equally about 30 seconds, and the rest of the film is a chore to watch.I don't think the film knows what aspect of the spy genre it wanted to parody, so it complete went into the Leslie Nielson school of sillyness.  There's so many things wrong here that kept "Leonard Part 6" from being whatever it is that Bill Cosby imagined it to be.  It's an incomprehensible stroll across random comedic set-pieces, right from the start of the cheap opening credits.  I like nonsequitous humor, but there's no spunk or unpredictability to be had in many moments: Leonard's ex-wife pours soup on Cosby because of a 19-year-old girl (his daughter?...creepy), he spoke to a gypsy that doesn't speak his language and randomly appear in a cheap edit shot, a shoot-out in a kitchen but the chefs didn't notice, and how the bad guys are defeated by raw meat.  To me, these jokes are the result of the lack of creativity and a very lazy mind; heck, I could tell from Cosby's face that not even he understood the point of those jokes.There's potential to be had here, but "Leonard Part 6" didn't know what to do with it.  "Austin Powers" and "Get Smart" got the right idea, but this movie is all about sound and fury, signifying dumbness.
summary: The Worst of the Unseen Sequels

reviewText: Ok, so what if "Leonard, Part 6" was not one of Cosby's best efforts?  At least it was fun to watch even if it wasn't funny all the way through.  Cos himself, realizing he was making a mistake, denounced the film, even accepted the razzies he won for it and even bought the TV rights so it wouldn't be seen on TV.  It's just one of those cult films like The Rocky Horror Picture Show, Shock Treatment, Mommie Dearest and Attack of The Killer Tomatoes, it's so bad that it's good.  I just happen to be one of those people who likes cult films and I guess LP6 is one of them.
summary: Underrated, not even his favorite, but a fun watch.

reviewText: In this overlooked gem, Bill Cosby plays a suave and sophisticated secret agent. He does this so well, that you forget that he is the lovable Dr. Huxtable from The Cosby Show. This is acting. Tom Courtenay, a fine British actor (The Dresser, Dr. Zhivago) plays Leonard's faithful manservant in an understated and well-reasoned performance. I don't see why so many choose to flame this fine film. I doubt they even viewed it. I saw it when it came out (I was one of the few lucky ones) and I am so delighted to own it on DVD, so my children can share the magic. I hope Cosby will return to cinema and give us another Leonard or Ghost Dad.

reviewText: Bull ish to all haters!! Leonard 6 is a creatively inspired stroke of genius!  To see the film as cheesy is to misunderstand its entire concept! It's supposed to be cheesy, that's the whole idea!  A villianous kook bites a magic hotdog and his head explodes!  "Quelish!!",  "Melted buter!"  Enchanted ballet slippers, killer lobsters and James Bond part twenty-something exploitation!  Bill Cosby was on some old next sh**!!  Finally this joint has been released on DVD! reviewText: Former CIA agent Leonard Parker (Bill Cosby) was retired 7 years ago as he's a owner of a successful restraunt and rich as hell. He lost his wife (Pat Colbert)as he wants everything to get her back and his sexy stripper daughter is getting married to a black Italian named Georgio (Moses Gun) yet he won't allow it as life is hard as it is. Evil vegetarian villainess named Medusa (Gloria Foster) who has an army of killer animals she uses to control with a special device to take over the world, Leonard is called forth to action again by an old friend Synderburn (Joe Don Baker) and with the help of a gibberish talking Gypsy (Carol Kane) who gives him supplies such as armpit missles, magic sparkling meat, ballet slippets, Alka-Selzter and more to ward off Medusa and her vegetarian warriors and try to save the world.A truly painful load of cinematic toxic waste this movie is! Bill Cosby had success in the 80's/early 90's with his "The Cosby Show" and is one of the most beloved comedians of all time. This is his ulimate low-point as it was a film he wrote he in 85 then filming started from december 1986 till early 1987 for a december 1987 release but Cosby regret making this movie as he knew the film was terrible. In fact he warned audiences on talk-shows and on TV to stay away from this movie to save their money on something else, i'm glad he did denounced this movie and disowned it. I can't believe he sunk low with such garbage like this one as this movie makes absolutely no sense whatsoever. This movie is a true megabomb in the sense of the word as this movie tries to be "comedy" when it's totally unfunny and the script is that like a second grader wrote it and the acting/direction is totally bad as ever. I remembered when i was 6 back in early 1988 i rented this disaster and thought it was dumb as hell as i always remember that scene where the gay eye-browless baddie who works for Medusa eats that magic hot-dog then his head blows up into crushed cheetos. Although Elmer Bernstein did a decent score but it's not enough to save this steaming heap of dung.The old saying is that you can't polish a turd but the DVD looks decent as is the sound with zero extras.

reviewText: Leonard Part 6 starts out pretty surreal.  You are thinking "What the heck have I gotten myself into?"  But a few minutes later, you are hooked.  You are laughing in spite of yourself.Leonard Part 6 stars Bill Cosby in a story of his own creation, although someone else wrote the screenplay.  He is a former CIA agent who owns a fancy restaurant.  The CIA wants him to come back to duty to stop a mad vegetarian woman (Gloria Foster) who wants to use animals to take over the world.  She claims she is helping the animals because they have been exploited, but she is exploiting them herself in mind control experiments.  Leonard does not want to return to duty because that is the reason his wife (Pat Colbert) left him seven years ago.  Leonard's flighty daughter (Victoria Rowell) comes to visit, bringing in tow a big phony "French" speaking sixty year-old man to whom she is engaged.  Leonard has helping him a gibbering gypsy who lives in a bus, and also a dedicated butler (Tom Courtenay).This film is a lot like the Naked Gun.  If you liked that, you will like this.  Me and my husband laughed so much.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Finally it's released on DVD!! I have been waiting for a long time for this movie. I originally heard about LEONARD PART 6 when I was a kid. My dad had video-taped Christmas specials for me and my sister, videos that we still enjoy to this day. Well, my dad has never known how to use a remote, so it caught all the commercials, as well, including a trailer for LEONARD PART 6. I remember seeing the trailer and thinking how cheesy it sounded, and wanting to see it. I finally got my chnace 2 years ago, at a clearance sale at the video store near me. When I saw it, and how cheap it was, I just knew that I had to have it. When I watched it later, I was amazed at how brilliant it was! Everything about this film is underrated!For those who haven't seen it, here's a short synopsis: After separating from his wife, Leonard Parker (Cosby) quit the spy business and became a restauraniuer. His wife refuses to speak with him, and his daughter, who changes her career more often than her clothes, has begun dating a man old enough to be Leonard's father! On top of it all, the government has asked him to come back and save the world again. The evil Medusa Johnson (Foster) has hypnotised animals into doing her bidding, and plans to use them to take over the world! Only Leonard can battle her Vegetarians and man-eating rabbits!Really, this is a great film. If you like ballet, ostritches, and exploding vegetarians, this is the movie for you!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is one of those rare, life-altering films that only comes along once in a lifetime. I will never look at the world the same again!Filled with facinating characters, mind-blowing stuntwork, super-hot romance, and a  plot Rod Serling and Alfred Hitchcock would be hard pressed to ever top  (especially since they're both dead), Leonard 6 is a masterpiece.This  film is so popular, I couldn't find it in over 4 different video stores,  and it's like 10 years old! Then, the last video store we went to actually  had it! The owner understood our thirst to experience the film, so after  laughing heartily at us, he offered to sell it to us for 5 dollars!  Can  you imagine our delight?  We bought it on the spot!I am currently  engaged in a very serious cause to have Leonard 1-5 made.  In light of the  recent success of the Star Wars prequil, I would imagine Leonard awaits the  same results!  I know that the film states that Leonards 1-5 are  "still classified and not yet ready for public release" but  c'mon...who are we worried about, the Nazis or something?  I thought the  Cuban Missle Crisis was over!Now for some reason, I can't get Stanley  Kubrick to answer any of my letters, as he is my first choice to direct the  prequals.  If anyone knows why he is being so snobby, please tell me!

reviewText: It's popular to call "Leonard Part 6" one of the worst movies ever made and it's certainly not a good movie, but it's far from the worst movie ever made.The main problem with the movie is that the script is so disjointed. The main plot revolves around how ex-CIA-agent Leonard Parker, who now owns a restaurant, goes out of retirement to fight some killer animals controlled by the evil Medusa Johnson (entertainingly played by Gloria Foster (today better known as "The Oracle" in "The Matrix"). Then there's a subplot about how Leonard tries to reconcile with his wife who's left him, and there's a subplot that involes his daughter wanting to get married to a much older man and wanting to be an actress, so Leonard has to go see her show. All of this is more or less irrelevant to the main plot.The main plot, then, is very silly but that's to be expected from a comedy. But it's only occasionally funny. There's a recurring joke about how Leonard's wife pours food on him that is just weird and hard to believe anyone would find funny. But still, the movie is watchable and certainly not as bad as, for example,Charlie's Angels. It's more on the level of "Spy Kids" (except for the disjointed plot). So Cosby fans may want to check it out, others needn't bother to seek it out, but it's not so bad it's not worth watching on TV if there's nothing better on.
summary: Not good but not THAT bad
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have seen a lot of trash cinema in my day, most of it poorly funded and made by people without much inherent talent. Neither is the case here, which is why "Leonard Part 6" is a painful embarrassment. It's a given that this is my least favorite Bill Cosby vehicle in history, but that it's also the worst Joe Don Baker film I've seen reveals more. Don't get me wrong, I like Joe Don Baker ("Mitchell!") and he's the best actor with the most nuanced performance here without question, but even his performance as Snyderburn can't save this mess.The plot is about a megalomaniac vegetarian activist hiding out at her headquarters in the "International Tuna" building taking over the world by controlling animals. This sets up the hilarity for the protagonists to battle homicidally possessed but otherwise cute creatures (frogs, rabbits, lobsters, etc.) The film starts terribly (Cosby riding an ostrich anyone?) and quickly evolves to a death by hairball scene that you will not quickly forget. The whole mess is narrated by Leonard's butler, as it makes the unfolding continuity disaster easier to follow. I mean, how else could you rationalize Bill Cosby racing through the streets in a rocket-powered camouflaged Porsche with roof cannon confronting evil vegetarians and a hostile anteater segueing into a terrible modern dance spectacle? Along the way there's romance gone awry and righted, largely through the therapeutic application of a tureen of soup to Bill Cosby's suit and hair. (Seriously, how was the food on Cosby even supposed to be funny? Anyone?) But if that's not enough to keep your interest, how would like to see Bill Cosby perform surgery on himself? Sounds hilarious, right? No? I will not even address the ludicrous climax other than to say that repelling lobsters with butter and using a magical hotdog to decapitate your foe made me literally scream "Just please end!" at the television. (I really did.)I do have one lingering issue with this film: Alka-Seltzer and Lava soap are both prominently featured in this movie. Did some marketing genius actually pay for product placement in this disaster? That was (really) the biggest question I had after watching "Leonard Part 6."This is epically bad, and despite being warned of the intrinsic awfulness of this movie, I have to admit that even I had no idea how repellant it is. As much as I enjoy "Red Zone Cuba," "Plan 9 From Outer Space," or even the Rick Sloane anti-masterpiece "Hobgoblins" I found "Leonard Part 6" so bad it was just bad.
summary: So Bad It's...Oh Who's Kidding Who? It's Awful.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Haha. That's just a joke. There is only part 6. That was supposed to be a joke too. Now you don't know about this movie because there was actually a cover-up initiated by The Cos himself because he was so embarrassed about it!After you sit through the painful, hand drawn credit-sequence you get to watch the only part of the film worth watching! This is extremely handy because you now no longer have to watch the rest of the movie. They were nice enough to put the funniest parts of the film, spliced together at the beginning of the film for us! In a split second we see: a tank car soaring through the air, Cos in a spacesuit dancing ballet w/ pink ballet slippers, and Cos in a janitor's uniform riding an ostrich through a roaring ball o' fire!!! By the time this sequence is over you will be rolling on the floor laughing, struggling to keep your head so you don't miss the rest of this hilarious film.But you wait and wait. That's it, that was the only part of the film worth watching. You will get to see these scenes again, but what's the point? You've already seen them and in context they aren't even half as funny. This movie is supposed to be the Cosby Show meets James Bond. The plot involves some animal rights terrorists and the Cos has to stop them. Along the way he has probs with his wife and daughter which eventually get solved in the end.It's supposed to be a comedy, but the jokes are lame and unoriginal and struggle too hard to be funny, not unlike Michael Richards after a long day at the Laugh Factory. Only you won't get an insincere apology from this turkey.The most painful part of this movie is seeing the wonderful and talented Bill Cosby being raped of all respect from this shameless failure in cinema. I can't let the Cos off too easy though. He COULD have livened things up. He COULD have at least made a Jell-o pudding pop joke.When all is said and done we cannot let Cos escape this miserable failure. He must atone for his sins. Reporters, ask him about this movie at EVERY opportunity. Fans, during his live appearances shout "Free Leonard!...Part 6!" Presidents of global imperial powers, detain Cos for questioning, water board him until he admits that he made this miserable failure. Force him to pay reparations for what this movie has done!
Title: N/A
